intro: Tordylium cordatum subsp. trachycarpum, commonly known as the rough-seeded tordylium, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, stiff hairs. The flowers are small and clustered in cymes, typically white or pale green in color. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that splits open to release the seeds. This subspecies is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
